search_prompt_message.string: Find your podcast, we'll check your setup

search_placeholder.string: Podcast name or rss feed url

prefix_found_on_all_episodes.string: OP3 prefix found on all episodes

prefix_found_on_some_episodes.string: OP3 prefix found on n episodes

prefix_found_on_some_episodes_prompt.string: Did you want to add it to every episode?

stats_page_line_1.string: Want to see this podcast's show stats page?

stats_page_line_2.string: Once OP3 has observed a few days of downloads, it will be available here

instructions_box_line_1.string: OP3 works like any other podcast prefix analytics service, except simpler! No login or signup needed. Podcasters or podcast hosting companies can prepend

instructions_box_line_2.string: to podcast episode urls in their feed to participate and start measuring downloads.

instructions_box_line_3.string: (No need to remove existing prefixes, there can be more than one)

instructions_box_line_4.string: Some podcast hosting companies (like Megaphone) enable you to add a custom prefix in your podcast's dashboard, and some (like Transistor and Castopod) make it as easy as checking a box!

instructions_box_line_5.string: If your podcast hosting company doesn't have a spot in the dashboard to enable a custom prefix, most will add it if you email support.

target_http_enclosure_instructions.string: Including the full protocol after the prefix is only necessary when the target is http.

optional_prefix_arguments_line_1.string: Pass optional arguments to the prefix as comma-delimited name=value pairs between the e and the /.

optional_prefix_arguments_line_2.string: OP3 currently supports one optional parameter named pg, allowing you to specify your Podcast GUID.

optional_prefix_arguments_line_3.string: While optional, this will help us more quickly attribute the episode url to a podcast.  You can look up your Podcast GUID using the form above.
